page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: This area contains four villages; {Great Clifton,Bridgefoot, Little {Clifton and Greysouthen.}The area is mainly used for dairy farming. Most people travel to the local towns to work. These are Workington, Cockermouth, Whitehaven and Maryport. We border the Northwestern edge of the {Lake District National park}and are near Ennerdale and Buttermere. We have extensive views across the mountains. The river{Derwent}flows through the middle of the area and is very popular for salmon and sea trout fishing. The river empties into the sea at Workington. A new section of the A66, the trunk road connecting West Cumbria with the M6, bisects the area.The intersection of the A66 and the A595, the road to Whitehaven and Egremont is in the centre of the area.
